result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica Anne Kriston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was given. Cash bail from 14CF5271 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic abuse counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erica Anne Kriston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erica Anne Kriston in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Erica Anne Kriston in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: William H.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic abuse counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was given. Cash bail from 14CF5271 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
from Jerome C. on behalf of the defendant received and filed.  rmm
from the defendant's mother received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
from Heidi W. on behalf of the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
from Amy M. on behalf of the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Erica Anne Kriston in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Bail Jumping, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 5/11/15 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Erica Anne Kriston in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. On motion of the State, Court ordered case numbers 14CF5271 and 15CF1630 for the purpose of trial.   Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brigido L.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON 4/22/15. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of any weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Erica Anne Kriston in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
